data.title: Lamiaceae
data.text:
Achyrospermum Blume

Last edited by Pieter B. Pelser, 14 September 2019

Achyrospermum densiflorum Blume , Bijdr. (1826) 840 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 412; Keng, Gard. Bull. Sing. 24 (1969) 23; Fl. Males. ser. 1, 8 (1978) 328; Type: from Java. = Achyrospermum philippinense Benth. , Prodr. 12 (1848) 458; Type: Cuming 1884 (K), Philippines. Distribution: China, India, Java, Lesser Sunda Isls, Philippines, Sumatra. LEYTE, LUZON: Batangas, Benguet, Laguna, NCR, Quezon, Rizal, MINDANAO: Davao del Sur, MINDORO, PALAWAN, PANAY (photos). Native.

Ajuga L.

Last edited by Pieter B. Pelser, 14 September 2019

Ajuga integrifolia Buch.-Ham. ex D.Don , Prodr. Fl. Nepal. (1825) 108; Type: from Nepal. = Ajuga bracteosa Wall. ex Benth. in Wall. , Pl. As. Rar. 1 (1830) 59, nom. illeg., nom. superfl. ; Wall., Cat. 1829, no. 2032, nom. inval., nom. nud.; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 408; Keng, Gard. Bull. Sing. 24 (1969) 31; Fl. Males. ser. 1, 8 (1978) 31; Type: from Nepal. Distribution: Afghanistan, China, India, Indochina, Moluccas, Myanmar, New Guinea, Philippines, Ryukyu Isls, Sulawesi, Taiwan, Thailand. BATAN, LUZON: Benguet, Cavite, Ifugao, Mountain Province, MINDANAO: Agusan del Norte, Lanao del Norte, Lanao del Sur, NEGROS (photos). Native.

Ajuga taiwanensis Nakai ex Murata , Acta Phytotax. Geobot. 23 (1968) 23. Distribution: Philippines, Ryukyu Isls, Taiwan. Notes: P.B. Pelser (14-Sep-19): not recorded for the Philippines by Bramley (2019). Native.

Anisomeles R.Br.

Last edited by Pieter B. Pelser, 14 September 2019

Anisomeles indica (L.) Kuntze , Rev. Gen. Pl. 2 (1891) 512 ; Merr., Fl. Manila (1912) 411; EPFP 3 (1923) 412; Keng, Gard. Bull. Sing. 24 (1969) 34; Fl. Males. ser. 1, 8 (1978) 329; â¡ Epimeredi indicus (L.) Rothm. , Feddes Repert. Spec. Nov. Regni Veg. 53 (1944) 12; â¡ Nepeta indica L. , Sp. Pl. (1753) 571; Type: from India. = Anisomeles indica forma albiflora (Hassk.) Kuntze , Rev. Gen. Pl. 2 (1891) 512; â¡ Anisomeles malabarica var. albiflora Hassk. , Pl. Jav. Rar. (1848) 485. = Anisomeles indica forma rubicunda Kuntze , Rev. Gen. Pl. 2 (1891) 512. = Phlomis alba Blanco , Fl. Filip. (1837) 474, nom. illeg., non Forssk; Type: Merrill Species Blancoanae 612 (K, neo; US, isoneo), Luzon: Rizal, Antipolo. Distribution: Andaman Isls, Bangladesh, Bismarck Arch, Borneo, Cambodia, China, India, Indian Ocean, Japan, Java, Laos, Lesser Sunda Isls, Malay Peninsula, Moluccas, Myanmar, Nepal, New Guinea, Nicobar Isls, Pacific Ocean, Pakistan, Philippines, Ryukyu Isls, Sri Lanka, Sulawesi, Sumatra, Taiwan, Thailand, Tibet, Vietnam. BATAN, BOHOL, CAGAYAN DE SULU, CATANDUANES, JOLO, LUZON: Apayao, Bataan, Batangas, Bulacan, Cagayan, Ilocos Norte, Laguna, NCR, Pangasinan, Rizal, Sorsogon, MINDANAO: Agusan del Norte, Davao, Zamboanga del Norte, MINDORO, SIASI, SULU ARCHIPELAGO. Native.

Basilicum Moench

Last edited by Pieter B. Pelser, 14 September 2019

Basilicum polystachyon (L.) Moench , Suppl. Meth. Pl. (1802) 143 ; Keng, Gard. Bull. Sing. 24 (1969) 39; Fl. Males. ser. 1, 8 (1978) 366; â¡ Moschosma polystachyum (L.) Benth. in Wall. , Pl. As. Rar. 2 (1830-31) 13 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 421; â¡ Ocimum polystachyon L. , Mant. Pl. 2 (1771) 567; Type: India. â Moschosma tenuiflorum auct. non (L.) Heynh. ; Merr., Fl. Manila (1912) 421. Distribution: Africa, Australia, Bangladesh, Bismarck Arch, Borneo, Cambodia, China, India, Indian Ocean, Java, Lesser Sunda Isls, Madagascar, Malay Peninsula, Middle East, Moluccas, Myanmar, New Guinea, Philippines, Solomon Isls, Sri Lanka, Sulawesi, Sumatra, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam. LUZON: Bataan, Ifugao, Ilocos Norte, NCR, Nueva Vizcaya (photos), Pampanga, Rizal. Native.

Callicarpa L.

Last edited by Pieter B. Pelser, 21 March 2024

Callicarpa albidotomentella Merr. , PJS 12c (1917) 300 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 382; Type: BS 26976 Ramos (K, lecto; A, isolecto), Luzon: Abra, Mt Posuey, along small streams in forests, c. 120m, 5-Feb-1917. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. LUZON: Abra. Notes: Lowland forests along streams. Only known from type (Bramley 2013). Conservation status: Endangered (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa angusta Schauer in DC., Prodr. 11 (1847) 643 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 382; Type: Cuming 1425 (K, lecto; BM, NY, P, isolecto), Luzon: Nueva Ecija, 1841. = Callicarpa erioclona forma rivularis (Merr.) Bakh. , Bull. Jard. Bot. Buitenz. 3, 3 (1921) 19; â¡ Callicarpa rivularis Merr. , PJS 7c (1912) 340 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 387; Type: BS 660 Foxworthy (US, lecto), Palawan: Palawan, Mt Victoria, on rocky riverbanks, c. 1150m, 23-Mar-1906. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. BILIRAN, LUZON: Albay, Aurora, Bulacan, Cagayan, Camarines Norte, Isabela, Nueva Ecija, Quezon, Rizal, Zambales, MINDORO, PALAWAN. Conservation status: Near Threatened (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa apoensis Elmer , LPB 3 (1910) 861 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 382; Type: Elmer 11491 (GH, lecto; BM, BO, GH, NY, Z, isolecto), Mindanao: Davao, Mt Apo, Todaya, Aug-1909. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. MINDANAO: Cotabato (photos), Davao, Davao del Sur. Notes: Forests, c. 1750m. Conservation status: Critically Endangered (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa arborea Roxb. , Fl. Ind., ed. Carey & Wall., I (1820) 405 ; Hort. Bengal. 10 (1814), nom. inval., nom. nud.; Fl. Ind., ed. Carey, 1 (1832) 390. = Callicarpa arborea var. psilocalyx (H.J.Lam) Moldenke , Phytologia 4 (1952) 125; â¡ Callicarpa lantana var. psilocalyx H.J.Lam , Verbenac. Malay Arch. (1919) 81. = Callicarpa tomentosa var. magna (Schauer) Bakh. , Bull. Jard. Bot. Buitenzorg ser. 3, 3 (1921) 22; â¡ Callicarpa magna Schauer , Prodr. 11 (1847) 641 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 386; Type: Cuming 1266 (K, lecto; BM, E, K, MICH, MO, isolecto), Luzon: Albay (Cagayan). Distribution: Bangladesh, Bhutan, Cambodia, China, India, Laos, Malay Peninsula, Myanmar, Nepal, New Guinea, Pakistan, Philippines, Singapore, Sri Lanka, Sumatra, Vietnam. BILIRAN, LUZON: Albay, Aurora, Benguet, Cagayan, Camarines Sur, Isabela, Laguna, Pampanga, Quezon, MINDANAO: Cotabato, PALAWAN, SAMAR. Notes: Chiefly in lowland and medium elevation secondary forests. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa basilanensis Merr. , PJS 3c (1908) 263 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 382; Type: FB 6124 Hutchinson (NY, lecto; K, US, isolecto), Jul-1906. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. BASILAN, MINDANAO: Misamis Occidental, Zamboanga Sibugay, Zamboanga del Norte, Zamboanga del Sur, SULU ARCHIPELAGO. Notes: Chiefly in lowland secondary forests. Conservation status: Vulnerable (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa bicolor Juss. , Ann. Mus. Paris 7 (1806) 77; Type: from New Britain. = Callicarpa bicolor var. bermejosii Moldenke , Phytologia 14 (1967) 398; Type: BS 1534 J. Bermejos (US, holo; NY, iso), Mindoro: Mindoro Oriental, Bulalacao. = Callicarpa bicolor var. subintegrifolia Moldenke , Phytologia 15 (1967) 399; Type: PNH 39880 J. Ramos (US, holo), Luzon: Laguna, Pangil, 27-May-1959. â Callicarpa cana auct. non L. ; Merr., Fl. Manila (1912) 401; EPFP 3 (1923) 382. â Callicarpa candicans auct. non (Burm.f.) Hochr. Distribution: New Guinea, Pacific Ocean, Philippines, Sulawesi. BOHOL, CEBU, CORON, CULION, DINAGAT, DONDONAY, LEYTE, LUZON: Bataan, Bulacan, Cagayan, Laguna, NCR, Pangasinan, Quezon, Rizal, MINDANAO: Cotabato, Davao, Lanao del Norte, Lanao del Sur, Misamis Oriental, Surigao del Norte, MINDORO, NEGROS, PALAWAN, ROMBLON. Notes: Open areas, thickets or disturbed. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa caudata Maxim. , Bull. Acad. St. Petersb. 31 (1887) 76 ; Merr., PJS 2 c (1907) Bot. 299; PJS 5 c (1910) Bot. 381; EPFP 3 (1923) 383; Elmer, LPB 3 (1910) 862; Type: Cuming 1095 (LE, holo; K, NY, iso), Luzon: Albay. = Callicarpa stenophylla Merr. , PJS 5c (1910) 380 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 388; Type: BS 5739 Ramos (K, lecto), Luzon: Benguet, Sablan River near Baguio, Dec-1908. = Callicarpa merrillii Moldenke , Bull Torrey Bot. Club (1932) 55; â¡ Callicarpa lancifolia Merr. , PJS 10c (1915) 70, nom. illeg.; Type: BS 11078 Ramos (PNH, holo, lost), Cebu, Mar-1912; R.S. Williams 2307 (NY, lecto; A, K, US, isolecto), Mindanao: Zamboanga, 25-Feb-1905. = Callicarpa caudata var. magna H.J.Lam , Verbenaceae Malayan Archipel. (1919) 60. = Callicarpa caudata var. simplicipuberula H.J.Lam , Verbenaceae Malayan Archipel. (1919) 61. Distribution: Australia, Moluccas, New Guinea, Philippines. BASILAN, BOHOL, LUZON: Abra, Albay, Benguet, Bulacan, Cagayan, Ilocos Norte, Ilocos Sur, Kalinga, Laguna, Mountain Province, Nueva Ecija, Quezon, Rizal, Zambales, MASBATE, MINDANAO: Bukidnon, Davao, Davao Oriental, Davao del Sur, Misamis Occidental, Surigao, Zamboanga Sibugay, Zamboanga del Norte, Zamboanga del Sur, MINDORO, NEGROS, TICAO. Notes: Forest, disturbed area, grasslands, up to 2000m. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa denticulata Merr. , PJS 3c (1908) 430 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 383; Type: BS 3622 E. Fenix (K, lecto), Batan: Basco, 30-May-1907. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. BATAN, BATANES, CAMIGUIN DE BABUYANES. Notes: Low elevation thickets, open slopes. Conservation status: Critically Endangered (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa dolichophylla Merr. , PJS 7c (1912) 339 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 384; Type: Cuming 1330 (K, lecto; A, K, NY, isolecto), Luzon: Cagayan, 1841. = Callicarpa longissima (Hemsl.) Merr. , PJS 12c (1917) 108; â¡ Callicarpa longifolia var. longissima Hemsl. , J. Linn. Soc., Bot. 26 (1890) 253; Type: from China. = Callicarpa caudata var. glabriuscula H.J.Lam , Verbenaceae Malayan Archipel. (1919) 61; Type: Cuming 1330, Luzon: Cagayan. Distribution: China, Philippines, Taiwan. BILIRAN, LUZON: Albay, Bulacan, Cagayan, Nueva Vizcaya, Rizal. Notes: Lowland or medium elevation thickets and secondary forests. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa erioclona Schauer in DC., Prodr. 11 (1847) 643 ; Fern.-Vill., Novis. App. (1880) 158; S.Vidal, Phan. Cuming. Philip. (1885) 134; Rev. Pl. Vasc. Filip. (1886) 208; Merr., PJS 1 (1906) Suppl. 121; EPFP 3 (1923) 384; Elmer, LPB 3 (1910) 866; Type: Cuming 911 (G, lecto; BM, E, G, NY, P, TCD, isolecto), Luzon: Albay. = Callicarpa subcandida Elmer , LPB 10 (1938) 3798; Type: Elmer 15124 (NY, lecto; BM, isolecto), Luzon: Irosin, Mt Bulusan. Distribution: Borneo, Java, New Guinea, Philippines, Sulawesi, Vietnam. BILIRAN, BOHOL, CATANDUANES, CEBU, DINAGAT, GUIMARAS, LEYTE, LUZON: Albay, Bataan, Batangas, Cagayan, Camarines Sur, Ilocos Norte, Laguna, NCR, Nueva Ecija, Nueva Vizcaya, Quezon, Rizal, Sorsogon, MINDANAO: Agusan del Norte, Cotabato, Davao, Davao del Sur, Misamis Occidental, Surigao del Norte, Zamboanga, Zamboanga del Sur, MINDORO, NEGROS, PALAWAN, POLILLO. Notes: In Luzon from Cagayan to Sorsogon. Lowland primary and secondary forests, often rather common. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa fasciculiflora Merr. , PJS 17 (1920) 313 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 384; Type: BS 35123 Ramos & Pascasio (A, lecto; K, P, isolecto), Bucas Grande: Jun-1919. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. BUCAS GRANDE. Notes: Low elevation open forests. Only known from type (Bramley 2013). Conservation status: Data Deficient (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa flavida Elmer , LPB 3 (1910) 863 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 384; â¡ Geunsia flavida (Elmer) H.J.Lam , Verb. Malay. Archipel. (1919) 38; Type: Elmer 11851 (K, lecto; BM, E, NY, isolecto), Mindanao: Davao, Todaya, Mt Apo. = Callicarpa epiphytica Elmer , LPB 8 (1915) 2871; â¡ Geunsia epiphytica (Elmer) H.J.Lam , Verb. Malay. Archipel. (1919) 38; Type: Elmer 13822 (K, lecto; C, E, NY, CAS, isolecto), Mindanao: Agusan, Cabadbaran, Mt Urdaneta, Sep-1912. = Geunsia epiphytica var. apiculata H.J.Lam , Verb. Malay. Archipel. (1919) 39; Type: Elmer 13861 (K, lecto; BM, E, NY, isolecto), Mindanao: Agusan, Cabadbaran, Sep-1912. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. DINAGAT, MINDANAO: Agusan, Agusan del Norte, Davao, Davao del Sur. Notes: Lowland forests on Dinagat, in Mindanao on mountains 1200-1500m. Conservation status: Vulnerable (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa longifolia Lam. , Encycl. 1 (1785) 563 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 385; Type: from Malaysia. = Callicarpa attenuifolia Elmer , LPB 8 (1915) 2870; Type: Elmer 13536 (BISH, GH, K, NA, NY, US, iso), Mindanao: Agusan del Norte, Cabadbaran, Mt Urdaneta, in rich humid soil of an open grassy place on Mt Giwantawan at 3000ft elevation, Aug-1912. = Callicarpa nigrescens Merr. , PJS 30 (1926) 425; Type: BS 44297 Ramos & EdaÃ±o (K, lecto; NY, US, isolecto), Tawi-tawi, in secondary forests at low elevations, Jul/Aug-1924. Distribution: Australia, India, Indochina, Malesia, Philippines. CATANDUANES, CEBU, LUZON: Apayao, La Union, Quezon, MINDANAO: Agusan, Agusan del Norte, Davao, Lanao, Lanao del Sur, Surigao, Zamboanga, Zamboanga del Sur, MINDORO, POLILLO, SULU ARCHIPELAGO, TAWI-TAWI. Notes: Low elevation secondary forest, 0-1200m. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa longipetiolata Merr. , Govt. Lab. Publ. (Philip.) 29 (1905) 47 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 386; â¡ Callicarpa tomentosa var. longipetiolata (Merr.) Bakh. , Bull. Jard. Bot. Buitenzorg sÃ©r. III, 3 (1921) 22; Type: Elmer 6266 (K, lecto; NY, isolecto), Luzon: Benguet, Mt Sto Tomas, May-1904. = Callicarpa longipetiolata var. glabrescens Moldenke , Phytologia 4 (1952) 43; Type: Vanoverbergh 1376 (U, holo; NY, iso), Luzon: Mountain Province, 20-Jun-1914. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. LUZON: Benguet, Ifugao, Mountain Province. Notes: Thickets bordering pine forests, 1600-2000m. Conservation status: Endangered (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa magnifolia Merr. , PJS 20 (1922) 437 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 386; Type: BS 37563 Ramos & EdaÃ±o (US, lecto; K, isolecto), Luzon: Kalinga, Lubuagan, Mt Masingit, Feb-1920. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. LUZON: Kalinga. Notes: Forests, c. 1200m. Only known from type (Bramley 2013). Conservation status: Endangered (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa micrantha S.Vidal , Phan. Cuming. Philipp. (1885) 187 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 386; Type: Vidal 1641 (K, lecto; MA, isolecto), Abra. = Callicarpa elegans Hayek , Justâs Bot. Jahresber. 33 (1906) 88 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 384; Type: Cuming 1460 (W, holo; K, NY, iso), Luzon: Camarines Sur. = Callicarpa phanerophlebia Merr. , PJS 12c (1917) 301 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 387; Type: BS 26233 Ramos & EdaÃ±o (NY, lecto; K, isolecto), Luzon: Nueva Ecija, Mt Umingan (Mingan), in open places along streams, c. 50m, 8-Aug-1916. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. BILIRAN, BOHOL, CEBU (photos), LEYTE, LUZON: Abra, Albay, Apayao, Bataan, Batangas, Bulacan, Cagayan, Camarines Sur, Cavite, Ilocos Norte, Ilocos Sur, Nueva Ecija, Nueva Vizcaya, Pangasinan, Quezon, Rizal, Zambales, MINDANAO: Cotabato, Davao, Davao Oriental, MINDORO, PANAY, ROMBLON, SIBUYAN. Notes: Lowland open places along streams, 200-1200m. Conservation status: Least Concern (Bramley 2013). Native.

Callicarpa pachyclada Quisumb. & Merr. , PJS 37 (1928) 195; Type: BS 45640 Ramos & EdaÃ±o (PNH, holo, lost; K, lecto; A, B, BM, BO, NY, UC, US, isolecto), Luzon: Quirino, Mt Alzapan, on forested slopes, c. 1600m, 24-May-1925. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. LUZON: Isabela, Nueva Vizcaya, Quirino, ?SAMAR. Notes: Montane forests, c. 1600m. Conservation status: Endangered (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa paloensis Elmer , LPB 1 (1908) 336 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 387; â¡ Callicarpa pentandra var. paloensis (Elmer) Bakh. , Bull. Jard. Bot. Buitenz. 3, 3 (1921) 14; â¡ Geunsia paloensis (Elmer) H.J.Lam ex Moldenke , Phytologia 50 (1950) 361; Type: Elmer 7370 (K, lecto; BO, GH, NY, isolecto), Leyte: Palo, Jan-1906. = Callicarpa sorsogonensis Elmer ex Bakh. , Bull. Jard. Bot. Buitenz. 3, 3 (1921) 22, nom. inval., pro syn.; Type: Elmer 16939 (NA, K, iso), Luzon: Sorsogon, Irosin, Mt Bulusan, Aug-1916. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. LEYTE, LUZON: Albay, Aurora (photos), Sorsogon. Notes: Forests, c. 300m. Conservation status: Vulnerable (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa pedunculata R.Br. , Prodromus florae Novae Hollandiae (1810) 513 ; Romeroso et al., Asian J. Biol. Life Sc. 10 (2021) 438; Type: from Australia. = Callicarpa formosana Rolfe , J. Bot. 20 (1882) 358 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 385; Yang et al., Fl. Taiwan ed. 2, 4 (1998) 406; Type: from Taiwan. = Callicarpa blancoi Rolfe , J. Linn. Soc. Bot. 21 (1884) 315 ; Merr., Fl. Manila (1912) 401. = Callicarpa ovata C.B.Rob. , PJS 3c (1908) 215; Type: R.S. Williams 2577 (NY, lecto; NY, US, isolecto), Mindanao, Davao, Darong, 9-Apr-1905. = Callicarpa obtusifolia Merr. , PJS 14 (1919) 451 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 387; Type: BS 32921 Ramos (K, lecto; A, isolecto), Luzon: Ilocos Norte, Burgos, Jul-1918. Distribution: Australia, China, Laos, Moluccas, New Guinea, Philippines, Ryukyu Isls, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam. APULIT, BAYAS, BILIRAN, BOHOL, CATANDUANES, DINAGAT, HOMONHON, LEYTE, LUZON: Abra, Albay, Apayao, Aurora, Bataan, Batangas, Benguet, Bulacan, Cagayan, Camarines Norte, Camarines Sur, Ifugao, Ilocos Norte, Isabela, La Union, Laguna, Mountain Province (photos), NCR, Nueva Vizcaya, Pampanga, Pangasinan, Quezon, Rizal, Sorsogon, Zambales, MASBATE, MINDANAO: Agusan del Norte, Bukidnon, Davao, Davao del Sur, Surigao, Zamboanga del Sur, MINDORO, POLILLO, SAMAR. Notes: Throughout the archipelago. Secondary and primary forest, grasslands. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa pentandra Roxb. , Fl. Ind. ed. 2, 1 (1832) 395 ; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 387; â¡ Geunsia pentandra (Roxb.) Merr. , PJS 11c (1916) 309 ; Kochummen, Tree Fl. Malaya 3 (1978) 305; Type: from Moluccas. = Geunsia farinosa Blume , Cat. Gew. Buitenz. (1823) 12; â¡ Callicarpa pentandra forma farinosa (Blume) Bakh. , Bull. Jard. Bot. Buitenz. 3, 3 (1921) 13; Type: from Indonesia. = Callicarpa cumingiana Schauer in DC. , Prodr. 11 (1847) 644 ; Fern.-Vill., Novis. App. (1880) 158; Merr., EPFP 3 (1923) 383; â¡ Geunsia cumingiana (Schauer) Rolfe , J. Linn. Soc. Bot. 21 (1884) 315 ; S.Vidal, Phan. Cuming. Philip. (1885) 133; Rev. Pl. Vasc. Filip. (1886) 207; Merr., PJS 7 c (1912) Bot. 343; â¡ Callicarpa pentandra var. cumingiana (Schauer) Bakh. , Bull. Jard. Bot. Buitenz. 3, 3 (1921) 16; Type: Cuming 1707 (K, lecto; P, isolecto), Philippines. = Callicarpa affinis Elmer , LPB 3 (1910) 864; Type: Elmer 11102 (K, lecto; GH, L, NY, US; isolecto), Mindanao: Davao, Mt Apo, Todaya, shrubberies near the sea coast, Jun-1909. = Geunsia hookeri Merr. , PJS 7c (1912) 342; Type: Cuming 1773 (K, lecto; GH, K, L, isolecto), Cebu. = Callicarpa weberi Merr. , PJS 12c (1917) 298 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 388; Type: Weber 68 (A, lecto), Bancalan Island (between Palawan and Balabac), 6m, 26-Sep-1916. = Callicarpa longivillosa Merr. , PJS 17 (1920) 313 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 386; Type: BS 34538 Ramos & Pascasio (K, lecto; BM, BO, L, isolecto), Mindanao: Surigao del Norte, Apr-1919. = Geunsia cumingiana var. pentamera H.J.Lam , Verb. Malay. Archipel. (1919) 36; Type: Com. d.l. Fl. for. no 844 (syn), Philippines, Daraga, and from New Guinea. = Callicarpa longivillosa Merr. , PJS 17 (1920) 313 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 386; Type: BS 34538 Ramos & Pascasio (L, iso), Mindanao: Surigao del Norte, Apr-1919. Distribution: Borneo, Java, Malay Peninsula, Moluccas, New Guinea, Philippines, ?Solomon Isls, Sulawesi, Sumatra, Thailand. BALABAC, BANCALAN, BILIRAN, BOHOL, BUCAS GRANDE, CAMIGUIN, CEBU, JOLO, LEYTE, LUZON: Albay, Camarines Sur, Rizal, Sorsogon, MINDANAO: Agusan, Agusan del Norte, Bukidnon, Cotabato, Davao, Davao del Sur, Lanao del Norte, Lanao del Sur, Misamis Occidental, Surigao, Zamboanga, Zamboanga del Sur, NEGROS, PALAWAN, PANAY, POLILLO, SAMAR, SIARGAO. Notes: Lowland and medium elevation secondary forests, ascending to 1700m. Conservation status: Least Concern (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa platyphylla Merr. , PJS 13c (1918) 57 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 387; Type: FB 26967 Velasco (A, US, lecto; US, isolecto), Luzon: Cagayan, Jul-Aug 1917. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. LUZON: Apayao (photos), Cagayan, Isabela, POLILLO. Notes: Lowland forests. Conservation status: Vulnerable (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa plumosa Quisumb. & Merr. , PJS 37 (1928) 196; Type: BS 46928 Ramos & EdaÃ±o (PNH, holo, lost; K, lecto; A, B, BM, BO, NY, UC, US, isolecto), Luzon: Isabela, San Mariano, along forested streams, c. 400m, 15-Mar-1926. Distribution: Endemic to the Philippines. LUZON: Isabela. Notes: Forested streams, c. 400m. Only known from type collection (Bramley 2013). Conservation status: Data Deficient (IUCN 3.1). Native.

Callicarpa ramiflora Merr. , PJS 3c (1908) 262 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 387; Type: M.S. Clemens 1167 (US, lecto), Mindanao: Lanao del Sur, Lake Lanao, Camp Keithley, Sep-1907. = Callicarpa cauliflora Merr. , PJS 7c (1912) 338 ; EPFP 3 (1923) 383; Type: FB 9321 Whitford & Hutchinson (US, lecto), Mindanao: Zamboanga del Sur, Port Banga, canyons in forest, c. 20m, 13-Jan-1908.
